p: Studies have also indicated that medicinal plants are very good sources of antioxidants and are reported to play a significant role in the treatment of diseases globally [ 29]. Many of these plants have been indicated to possess high antioxidant properties such as the reduction of DPPH radicals, due to the presence of bioactive secondary metabolites which are rich in antioxidants and free-radical scavenging properties in the crude extract; this agrees with the report of John Umaru et al. [ 29] of the antioxidant and antibacterial potential of Barringtonia asiatica stem bark to have IC 50 of 10.54 μg/mL higher than the IC 50 of the standard ascorbic acid 10.28 μg/mL.
